publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1572 Donald Gorrie: Rights of the Parliament—That the Parliament congratulates the Presiding Officer on standing up for the Parliament’s right to have ministers make announcements on policy matters to the Parliament, rather than leaking them in advance to the media.
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Shona Robison*, Mr John Munro*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Michael Matheson*, Linda Fabiani*, Alex Neil*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fergus Ewing*

S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Phil Gallie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Robert Brown*, Alasdair Morgan*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Bruce Crawford*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Mr Murray Tosh*, Nora Radcliffe*, John Scott*

S1M-1572 Donald Gorrie: Rights of the Parliament—That the Parliament congratulates the Presiding Officer on standing up for the Parliament’s right to have ministers make announcements on policy matters to the Parliament, rather than leaking them in advance to the media. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Mr John Munro, Michael Matheson, Linda Fabiani, Alex Neil, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Phil Gallie, Tommy Sheridan, Robert Brown, Alasdair Morgan, Roseanna Cunningham, Bruce Crawford, Mr Murray Tosh, Nora Radcliffe, John Scott, Christine Grahame*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*, David Mundell*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Michael Russell*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Ms Sandra White*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1572 Rights of the Parliament (lodged on 19 January 2001) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-1572 Donald Gorrie: Rights of the Parliament—That the Parliament congratulates the Presiding Officer on standing up for the Parliament’s right to have ministers make announcements on policy matters to the Parliament, rather than leaking them in advance to the media. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Mr John Munro, Michael Matheson, Linda Fabiani, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Phil Gallie, Tommy Sheridan, Robert Brown, Alasdair Morgan, Roseanna Cunningham, Bruce Crawford, Mr Murray Tosh, Nora Radcliffe, John Scott, Christine Grahame, Ms Margo MacDonald, David Mundell, Michael Russell, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Ms Sandra White, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Alex Neil
